name: Pumpkin Pasta Bake with Almond Ricotta
description: Pumpkin Pasta Bake with Almond Ricotta - A cheesy, creamy, delightful fall dinner, and it's completely vegan! Gluten free option.
recipeIngredient: 12 ounces rotini pasta (*gluten free if needed)
13.5 ounce can full fat coconut milk
2 cups baby spinach, sliced into ribbons
1 bag vegan mozzarella cheese shreds  (*I used Violife)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly spray a large casserole dish with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly spray a large casserole dish with oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook pasta according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook pasta according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the Vegan Ricotta, and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare the Vegan Ricotta, and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the pumpkin sauce: Warm a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the olive oil, onion and garlic and sauté for 3-4 minutes until translucent. Stir in the pumpkin, coconut milk, nutmeg, salt and pepper. Remove from heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the pumpkin sauce: Warm a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the olive oil, onion and garlic and sauté for 3-4 minutes until translucent. Stir in the pumpkin, coconut milk, nutmeg, salt and pepper. Remove from heat.

recipeInstructions.text: To the prepared casserole dish, add the pasta and pumpkin cream sauce. Stir to mix well, then stir in the spinach.
recipeInstructions.name: To the prepared casserole dish, add the pasta and pumpkin cream sauce. Stir to mix well, then stir in the spinach.

recipeInstructions.text: Add spoonfuls of the vegan ricotta to the dish, and mix slightly but leave chunks of cheese intact. Cover with vegan mozzarella, if using, and bake for 15-20 minutes until warm and the cheese has melted. Serve and enjoy!
